abstract: "Jesus Christ Superstar" which has been an audience and critical favorite there since May, will transfer to Broadway and begin preview performances on March 1.
snippet: "Jesus Christ Superstar" which has been an audience and critical favorite there since May, will transfer to Broadway and begin preview performances on March 1.
lead_paragraph: Musicals with religious themes - as well as those with Andrew Lloyd Webber scores - are filling up Broadway theaters this season. The Stratford Shakespeare Festival's production of Mr. Lloyd Webber's "Jesus Christ Superstar," which has been an audience and critical favorite there since May, will transfer to Broadway and begin preview performances on March 1, 2012, at the Neil Simon Theater, the producers announced on Tuesday. The revival of the 1971 rock opera, which has lyrics by Tim Rice, will first move to the La Jolla Playhouse later this year.
